title: Quick Whole Wheat Chapati Recipe
description: Fresh whole wheat chapati is quick, easy, and delicious; perfect with butter, as an accompaniment, or as a wrap!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Bread Quick Bread Recipes Quick Whole Wheat Chapati 4.8 (21) 16 Reviews 5 Photos Chapati is an unleavened whole wheat bread that is eaten in India. We love to use it as a wrap. Submitted by desertdweller Updated on November 20, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 5 5 5 5 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 8 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 2 ½ cups whole wheat flour ¾ teaspoon salt 1 cup water Directions Mix flour and salt together in a bowl. Stir in water to form a soft dough. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured work surface and knead several times. Divide into 8 pieces and roll each into a ball. Roll each ball into a very thin round using a rolling pin. Heat a griddle over medium-high heat. Cook each dough round on griddle until dough bubbles and blisters appear, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook until lightly browned on the other side. I Made It Print 33 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 127 Calories 1g Fat 27g Carbs 5g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 127 % Daily Value * Total Fat 1g 1% Saturated Fat 0g 1% Sodium 221mg 10% Total Carbohydrate 27g 10% Dietary Fiber 5g 16% Total Sugars 0g Protein 5g 10% Calcium 14mg 1% Iron 2mg 8% Potassium 152mg 3% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Quick Whole Wheat Chapati 01 of 05 Photo by  Lenka 02 of 05 Photo by  Lenka 09/17/2020 Maybe I overworked the dough or something but these were too hard to chew if not eaten right away. 03 of 05 Photo by  TexasHal 04/25/2020 04 of 05 Photo by  jmngroo 01/04/2017 05 of 05 Photo by  Lela 11/03/2013 I love the chapati. It has a nice flavor without the added lard or shortening. I did have to tweak the recipe. Only use 1/2 cup of water and then add water as needed. If you add a whole cup of water you will have a very sticky dough. Also, make sure your water is warm water. After making 8 small balls, let the dough rest for ten minutes before cooking. Meanwhile turn the heat to medium high on a cast iron griddle. Cook the chapati until you see bubbles start to form and then flip, about 10 seconds per side. Then flip for another ten seconds. Flip over again for another 10 seconds to make sure chapita is cooked. 1 You’ll Also Love Potato Chapati Bread 6 Ratings Parathas 1 Rating Whole Wheat Wraps 60 Ratings Butternut-Yogurt Bread Whole Wheat Beer Bread 737 Ratings Whole Wheat Chocolate Banana Bread 72 Ratings Whole Wheat Chapati 39 Ratings Boston Brown Bread 155 Ratings Oatmeal Whole Wheat Quick Bread 362 Ratings Irish Brown Soda Bread 148 Ratings Whole Wheat Molasses Flat Bread 21 Ratings Bread Machine Pumpernickel Bread 235 Ratings Whole Wheat Honey Bread 930 Ratings Easter Bunny Buns Aloo Paratha Whole Wheat Applesauce Biscuits 14 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: desertdweller
instructions: Mix flour and salt together in a bowl. Stir in water to form a soft dough.;Turn dough out onto a lightly floured work surface and knead several times. Divide into 8 pieces and roll each into a ball. Roll each ball into a very thin round using a rolling pin.;Heat a griddle over medium-high heat. Cook each dough round on griddle until dough bubbles and blisters appear, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook until lightly browned on the other side.
